name: proxmoxve
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`proxmox` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-proxmoxve` repo](https://github.com/muhlba91/pulumi-proxmoxve/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-proxmox` repo](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-proxmoxve` repo](https://github.com/muhlba91/pulumi-proxmoxve/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-proxmox` repo](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox/issues).

apiToken.description: The API token for the Proxmox VE API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Proxmox VE API.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step.

otp.description: The one-time password for the Proxmox VE API.
otp.deprecationMessage: The `otp` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `api_token` attribute instead.

password.description: The password for the Proxmox VE API.

ssh.description: The SSH configuration for the Proxmox nodes.

username.description: The username for the Proxmox VE API.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
disk in (defaults to `local`).

nodeName.description: The name of the node to assign the container to.

vmId.description: The container identifier

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the network device (defaults
to `true`).

ttyCount.description: The number of available TTY (defaults to `2`).

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
disk in (defaults to `local`).

size.description:
Volume size (only for volume mount points).
Can be specified with a unit suffix (e.g. `10G`).

fuse.description:
Whether the container supports FUSE mounts (defaults
to `false`)

keyctl.description:
Whether the container supports `keyctl()` system
call (defaults to `false`)

mounts.description: List of allowed mount types (`cifs` or `nfs`)

nesting.description:
Whether the container is nested (defaults
to `false`)

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

server.description: The DNS server. The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.
server.deprecationMessage: The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.

gateway.description:
The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

keys.description: The SSH keys for the root account.

password.description: The password for the root account.

dedicated.description:
The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults
to `512`).

swap.description: The swap size in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

acl.description: Explicitly enable or disable ACL support.

backup.description:
Whether to include the mount point in backups (only
used for volume mount points).

path.description:
Path to the mount point as seen from inside the
container.

quota.description:
Enable user quotas inside the container (not supported
with ZFS subvolumes).

replicate.description: Will include this volume to a storage replica job.

shared.description:
Mark this non-volume mount point as available on all
nodes.

size.description:
Volume size (only for volume mount points).
Can be specified with a unit suffix (e.g. `10G`).

volume.description:
Volume, device or directory to mount into the
container.

bridge.description:
The name of the network bridge (defaults
to `vmbr0`).

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the network device (defaults
to `true`).

firewall.description:
Whether this interface's firewall rules should be
used (defaults to `false`).

mtu.description:
Maximum transfer unit of the interface. Cannot be
larger than the bridge's MTU.

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

templateFileId.description: The identifier for an OS template file.

nomatch.description:
Entries marked as `nomatch` are skipped as if those
were not added to the set.

burst.description:
Initial burst of packages which will always get
logged before the rate is applied (defaults to `5`).

enabled.description: Enable or disable the log rate limit.

rate.description: Frequency with which the burst bucket gets refilled (defaults to `1/second`).

dest.description:
Restrict packet destination address. This can
refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias
definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and
IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match several
ports or ranges.

iface.description:
Network interface name. You have to use network
configuration key names for VMs and containers ('net\d+'). Host
related rules can use arbitrary strings.

macro.description:
Macro name. Use predefined standard macro
from <https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#_firewall_macro_definitions>

pos.description: Position of the rule in the list.

proto.description:
Restrict packet protocol. You can use protocol
names as defined in '/etc/protocols'.

source.description:
Restrict packet source address. This can refer
to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias
definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and
IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

sport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP source port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match several
ports or ranges.
- a security group insertion block, which includes the following arguments:

Restrict packet destination address. This can refer to
a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias definition.

a list of IP addresses and networks (entries are separated by comma).
Please do not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined in '/etc/services'.
Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for example `80:85`, and
you can use comma separated list to match several ports or ranges.

macro.description:
Macro name. Use predefined standard macro
from <https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#_firewall_macro_definitions>

inside such lists.

propagate.description: Whether to propagate to child paths.

vmId.description: The virtual machine identifier.

propagate.description: Whether to propagate to child paths.
Whether to propagate to child paths.

vmId.description: The virtual machine identifier.

propagate.description: Whether to propagate to child paths.

checksum.description: The SHA256 checksum of the source file.

insecure.description:
Whether to skip the TLS verification step for
HTTPS sources (defaults to `false`).

path.description: A path to a local file or a URL.

resize.description: The number of bytes to resize the file to.

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the VGA device (defaults
to `true`).

timeout.description:
The maximum amount of time to wait for data from
the QEMU agent to become available ( defaults to `15m`).

trim.description:
Whether to enable the FSTRIM feature in the QEMU agent
(defaults to `false`).

device.description:
The device (defaults to `socket`).
- `/dev/*` - A host serial device.

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the VGA device (defaults
to `true`).

Whether to enable the VGA device (defaults
to `true`).

fileId.description:
The file ID for a disk image (experimental -
might cause high CPU utilization during import, especially with large
disk images).

interface.description:
The hardware interface to connect the cloud-init
image to. Must be one of `ide0..3`, `sata0..5`, `scsi0..30`. Will be
detected if the setting is missing but a cloud-init image is present,
otherwise defaults to `ide2`.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

nodeName.description:
The name of the node to assign the virtual machine
to.

retries.description:
Number of retries in Proxmox for clone vm.
Sometimes Proxmox errors with timeout when creating multiple clones at
once.

vmId.description: The VM identifier.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

flags.description:
The CPU flags.
- `+aes`/`-aes` - Activate AES instruction set for HW acceleration.
- `+amd-no-ssb`/`-amd-no-ssb` - Notifies guest OS that host is not
vulnerable for Spectre on AMD CPUs.
- `+amd-ssbd`/`-amd-ssbd` - Improves Spectre mitigation performance with
AMD CPUs, best used with "virt-ssbd".
- `+hv-evmcs`/`-hv-evmcs` - Improve performance for nested
virtualization (only supported on Intel CPUs).
- `+hv-tlbflush`/`-hv-tlbflush` - Improve performance in overcommitted
Windows guests (may lead to guest BSOD on old CPUs).
- `+ibpb`/`-ibpb` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation on AMD CPUs.
- `+md-clear`/`-md-clear` - Required to let the guest OS know if MDS is
mitigated correctly.
- `+pcid`/`-pcid` - Meltdown fix cost reduction on Westmere, Sandy- and
Ivy Bridge Intel CPUs.
- `+pdpe1gb`/`-pdpe1gb` - Allows guest OS to use 1 GB size pages, if
host HW supports it.
- `+spec-ctrl`/`-spec-ctrl` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation with
Intel CPUs.
- `+ssbd`/`-ssbd` - Protection for "Speculative Store Bypass" for Intel
models.
- `+virt-ssbd`/`-virt-ssbd` - Basis for "Speculative Store Bypass"
protection for AMD models.

hotplugged.description:
The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults
to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage, `0...128`. (defaults to `0` -- no limit).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

discard.description:
Whether to pass discard/trim requests to the
underlying storage. Supported values are `on`/`ignore` (defaults
to `ignore`).

fileId.description:
The file ID for a disk image (experimental -
might cause high CPU utilization during import, especially with large
disk images).

interface.description:
The hardware interface to connect the cloud-init
image to. Must be one of `ide0..3`, `sata0..5`, `scsi0..30`. Will be
detected if the setting is missing but a cloud-init image is present,
otherwise defaults to `ide2`.

iothread.description:
Whether to use iothreads for this disk (defaults
to `false`).

pathInDatastore.description:
The in-datastore path to the disk image.
***Experimental.***Use to attach another VM's disks,
or (as root only) host's filesystem paths (`datastore_id` empty string).
See "*Example: Attached disks*".

size.description: The disk size in gigabytes (defaults to `8`).

ssd.description:
Whether to use an SSD emulation option for this disk (
defaults to `false`). Note that SSD emulation is not supported on VirtIO
Block drives.

read.description: The maximum read speed in megabytes per second.

readBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable read speed in
megabytes per second.

write.description: The maximum write speed in megabytes per second.

writeBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable write speed in
megabytes per second.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

preEnrolledKeys.description:
Use am EFI vars template with
distribution-specific and Microsoft Standard keys enrolled, if used with
EFI type=`4m`. Ignored for VMs with cpu.architecture=`aarch64` (defaults
to `false`).

device.description:
The device (defaults to `socket`).
- `/dev/*` - A host serial device.

id.description:
The PCI device ID. This parameter is not compatible
with `api_token` and requires the root `username` and `password`
configured in the proxmox provider. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description:
The resource mapping name of the device, for
example usbdevice. Use either this or `id`.

mdev.description: The mediated device ID to use.

pcie.description:
Tells Proxmox to use a PCIe or PCI port. Some
guests/device combination require PCIe rather than PCI. PCIe is only
available for q35 machine types.

romFile.description:
A path to a ROM file for the device to use. This
is a relative path under `/usr/share/kvm/`.

rombar.description:
Makes the firmware ROM visible for the VM (defaults
to `true`).

xvga.description:
Marks the PCI(e) device as the primary GPU of the VM.
With this enabled the `vga` configuration argument will be ignored.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

interface.description:
The hardware interface to connect the cloud-init
image to. Must be one of `ide0..3`, `sata0..5`, `scsi0..30`. Will be
detected if the setting is missing but a cloud-init image is present,
otherwise defaults to `ide2`.

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

metaDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all meta data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

networkDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
network configuration data passed to the VM via cloud-init (conflicts
with `ip_config`).

userDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
custom user data (conflicts with `user_account`).

vendorDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all vendor data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

server.description: The DNS server. The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.
server.deprecationMessage: The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.

address.description:
The IPv6 address in CIDR notation
(e.g. fd1c:000:0000::0000:000:7334/64).  Alternatively, set this
to `dhcp` for autodiscovery.

gateway.description:
The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

address.description:
The IPv6 address in CIDR notation
(e.g. fd1c:000:0000::0000:000:7334/64).  Alternatively, set this
to `dhcp` for autodiscovery.

gateway.description:
The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

dedicated.description:
The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults
to `512`).

floating.description:
The floating memory in megabytes (defaults
to `0`).

shared.description: The shared memory in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

bridge.description:
The name of the network bridge (defaults
to `vmbr0`).

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the VGA device (defaults
to `true`).

firewall.description:
Whether this interface's firewall rules should be
used (defaults to `false`).

mtu.description:
Force MTU, for VirtIO only. Set to 1 to use the bridge
MTU. Cannot be larger than the bridge MTU.

queues.description: The number of queues for VirtIO (1..64).

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

device.description:
The device (defaults to `socket`).
- `/dev/*` - A host serial device.

uuid.description: The UUID (defaults to randomly generated UUID).

order.description:
A non-negative number defining the general startup
order.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

host.description: The USB device ID. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description:
The resource mapping name of the device, for
example usbdevice. Use either this or `id`.

usb3.description:
Makes the USB device a USB3 device for the VM (defaults
to `false`).

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the VGA device (defaults
to `true`).

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (defaults to `16`).

tags.description:
A list of tags to filter the VMs. The VM must have all
the tags to be included in the result.

vmId.description: The VM identifier.

hostnames.description: The hostnames associated with each of the IP addresses.

provider.description:
The provider type for the proxmox package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apiToken.description: The API token for the Proxmox VE API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Proxmox VE API.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step.

otp.description: The one-time password for the Proxmox VE API.
otp.deprecationMessage: The `otp` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `api_token` attribute instead.

password.description: The password for the Proxmox VE API.

ssh.description: The SSH configuration for the Proxmox nodes.

username.description: The username for the Proxmox VE API.

proxmoxve:CT/container:Container.description:
Manages a container.


## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name` and the `vm_id`, e.g., bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import proxmoxve:CT/container:Container ubuntu_container first-node/1234
```

features.description: The container feature flags. Changing flags (except nesting) is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

nodeName.description: The name of the node to assign the container to.

poolId.description: The identifier for a pool to assign the container to.

startOnBoot.description: Automatically start container when the host system boots (defaults to `true`).

started.description: Whether to start the container (defaults to `true`).

tags.description:
A list of tags the container tags. This is only meta
information (defaults to `[]`). Note: Proxmox always sorts the container tags.
If the list in template is not sorted, then Proxmox will always report a
difference on the resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle
meta-argument to ignore changes to this attribute.

template.description: Whether to create a template (defaults to `false`).

unprivileged.description:
Whether the container runs as unprivileged on
the host (defaults to `false`).

vmId.description: The container identifier

ipfilter.description:
Enable default IP filters. This is equivalent to
adding an empty `ipfilter-net<id>` ipset for every interface. Such ipsets
implicitly contain sane default restrictions such as restricting IPv6 link
local addresses to the one derived from the interface's MAC address. For
containers the configured IP addresses will be implicitly added.

vmId.description: VM ID. Leave empty for cluster level aliases.

containerId.description: Container ID. Leave empty for cluster level aliases.

ipfilter.description:
Enable default IP filters. This is equivalent to
adding an empty `ipfilter-net<id>` ipset for every interface. Such ipsets
implicitly contain sane default restrictions such as restricting IPv6 link
local addresses to the one derived from the interface's MAC address. For
containers the configured IP addresses will be implicitly added.

contentType.description:
The content type. If not specified, the content type will be inferred from the file
extension. Valid values are:

overwrite.description:
Whether to overwrite an existing file (defaults to
`true`).

sourceFile.description:
The source file (conflicts with `source_raw`), could be a
local file or a URL. If the source file is a URL, the file will be downloaded
and stored locally before uploading it to Proxmox VE.

timeoutUpload.description:
Timeout for uploading ISO/VSTMPL files in
seconds (defaults to 1800).

proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachi.description:
Manages a virtual machine.

> This resource uses SSH access to the node. You might need to configure the `ssh` option in the `provider` section.

## Qemu guest agent

Qemu-guest-agent is an application which can be installed inside guest VM, see
[Proxmox Wiki](https://pve.proxmox.com/wiki/Qemu-guest-agent) and [Proxmox
Documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_qemu_agent)

For VM with `agent.enabled = false`, Proxmox uses ACPI for `Shutdown` and
`Reboot`, and `qemu-guest-agent` is not needed inside the VM.

Setting `agent.enabled = true` informs Proxmox that the guest agent is expected
to be *running* inside the VM. Proxmox then uses `qemu-guest-agent` instead of
ACPI to control the VM. If the agent is not running, Proxmox operations
`Shutdown` and `Reboot` time out and fail. The failing operation gets a lock on
the VM, and until the operation times out, other operations like `Stop` and
`Reboot` cannot be used.

Do **not** run VM with `agent.enabled = true`, unless the VM is configured to
automatically **start** `qemu-guest-agent` at some point.

"Monitor" tab in Proxmox GUI can be used to send low-level commands to `qemu`.
See the [documentation](https://www.qemu.org/docs/master/system/monitor.html).
Commands `system_powerdown` and `quit` have proven useful in shutting down VMs
with `agent.enabled = true` and no agent running.

Cloud images usually do not have `qemu-guest-agent` installed. It is possible to
install and *start* it using cloud-init, e.g. using custom `user_data_file_id`
file.

This provider requires `agent.enabled = true` to populate `ipv4_addresses`,
`ipv6_addresses` and `network_interface_names` output attributes.

Setting `agent.enabled = true` without running `qemu-guest-agent` in the VM will
also result in long timeouts when using the provider, both when creating VMs,
and when refreshing resources.  The provider has no way to distinguish between
"qemu-guest-agent not installed" and "very long boot due to a disk check", it
trusts the user to set `agent.enabled` correctly and waits for
`qemu-guest-agent` to start.

## Important Notes

When cloning an existing virtual machine, whether it's a template or not, the
resource will only detect changes to the arguments which are not set to their
default values.

Furthermore, when cloning from one node to a different one, the behavior changes
depening on the datastores of the source VM. If at least one non-shared
datastore is used, the VM is first cloned to the source node before being
migrated to the target node. This circumvents a limitation in the Proxmox clone
API.

**Note:** Because the migration step after the clone tries to preserve the used
datastores by their name, it may fail if a datastore used in the source VM is
not available on the target node (e.g. `local-lvm` is used on the source node in
the VM but no `local-lvm` datastore is available on the target node). In this
case, it is recommended to set the `datastore_id` argument in the `clone` block
to force the migration step to migrate all disks to a specific datastore on the
target node. If you need certain disks to be on specific datastores, set
the `datastore_id` argument of the disks in the `disks` block to move the disks
to the correct datastore after the cloning and migrating succeeded.


## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name` and the `vm_id`, e.g., bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachine ubuntu_vm first-node/4321
```

bootOrders.description:
Specify a list of devices to boot from in the order
they appear in the list (defaults to `[]`).

efiDisk.description:
The efi disk device (required if `bios` is set
to `ovmf`)

hookScriptFileId.description: The identifier for a file containing a hook script (needs to be executable).

hostpcis.description: A host PCI device mapping (multiple blocks supported).

ipv4Addresses.description:
The IPv4 addresses per network interface published by the
QEMU agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

ipv6Addresses.description:
The IPv6 addresses per network interface published by the
QEMU agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

macAddresses.description:
The MAC addresses published by the QEMU agent with fallback
to the network device configuration, if the agent is disabled

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (defaults to `16`).

migrate.description:
Migrate the VM on node change instead of re-creating
it (defaults to `false`).

networkInterfaceNames.description:
The network interface names published by the QEMU
agent (empty list when `agent.enabled` is `false`)

nodeName.description:
The name of the node to assign the virtual machine
to.

onBoot.description:
Specifies whether a VM will be started during system
boot. (defaults to `true`)

poolId.description:
The identifier for a pool to assign the virtual machine
to.

reboot.description:
Reboot the VM after initial creation. (defaults
to `false`)

smbios.description: The SMBIOS (type1) settings for the VM.

started.description:
Whether to start the virtual machine (defaults
to `true`).

startup.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the VM.

stopOnDestroy.description: Whether to stop rather than shutdown on VM destroy (defaults to `false`)

tabletDevice.description:
Whether to enable the USB tablet device (defaults
to `true`).

tags.description:
A list of tags of the VM. This is only meta information (
defaults to `[]`). Note: Proxmox always sorts the VM tags. If the list in
template is not sorted, then Proxmox will always report a difference on the
resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle meta-argument to ignore
changes to this attribute.

template.description: Whether to create a template (defaults to `false`).

timeoutClone.description:
Timeout for cloning a VM in seconds (defaults to
1800).

timeoutCreate.description:
Timeout for creating a VM in seconds (defaults to
1800).

timeoutMigrate.description:
Timeout for migrating the VM (defaults to
1800).

timeoutMoveDisk.description:
Timeout for moving the disk of a VM in
seconds (defaults to 1800).

timeoutReboot.description:
Timeout for rebooting a VM in seconds (defaults
to 1800).

timeoutShutdownVm.description:
Timeout for shutting down a VM in seconds (
defaults to 1800).

timeoutStartVm.description:
Timeout for starting a VM in seconds (defaults
to 1800).

timeoutStopVm.description:
Timeout for stopping a VM in seconds (defaults
to 300).

proxmoxve:index/dNS:DNS.description:
Manages the DNS configuration for a specific node.

## Important Notes

Be careful not to use this resource multiple times for the same node.


## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name`, e.g., bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import proxmoxve:index/dNS:DNS first_node first-node
```

entries.description:

objects).

objects).
